description: APPLICATION FOR PRIOR APPROVAL IN RESPECT OF THE PROPOSED ERECTION OF A SINGLE STOREY REAR EXTENSION WITH A DEPTH OF 4M, MAXIMUM HEIGHT OF 4M AND EAVES HEIGHT OF 3M
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The operations would consist of the enlargement of a dwelling house within the meaning of Class A of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class A. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.
Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Drawing no (Existing BLOCK PLAN) Received 09/05/2024. 
Drawing no.(PROPOSED GROUND FLOOR PLAN) Received 09/05/2024.
Drawing no.(PROPOSED FRONT ELEVATION PLAN AA) Received 09/05/2024.
Drawing no. (PROPOSED REAR ELEVATION PLAN BB), Received 09/05/2024.
Site Photographs of the Front Elevation And Rear Elevation including part of the Rear Garden Received 09th May 2024.  
Condition : 3 - 1.It is a requirement of paragraph A.3 of the above legislation that the materials used in any exterior work (other than materials used in the construction of the conservatory) shall be of a similar appearance to those used in the construction of the exterior of the existing dwellinghouse.
Condition : 4 - 2  .It is a requirement of Condition A.4 that the development shall be carried out in accordance with the information that the developer provided to the Local Planning Authority, unless the local planning authority and the developer agree otherwise in writing. It is a requirement of Condition A.4 that the development shall be carried out in accordance with the submitted drawings and information that the developer provided to the local planning authority, unless the local planning authority and the developer agree otherwise in writing.


Condition : 5 - ADVICE NOTE
(1)It is no longer a requirement that the development shall be completed on or before 30th May 2019.
Condition : 6 - (2)It is no longer a requirement that the developer notifies the local planning authority of the completion of the development as soon as reasonably practicable after completion, in writing including (a) the name of the developer, (b) the address or location of the development, and (c) the date of completion
Condition : 7 - INFORMATIVE (Party Wall Act) - The applicant is advised to check the requirements of the Party Wall Act 1996 relating to work on an existing wall shared with another property, building on the boundary with a neighbouring property, or excavating near a neighbouring building. Further information is available at the following link: 
http://www.planningportal.gov.uk/buildingregulations/buildingpolicyandlegislation/current legislation/partywallact
Condition : 8 - INFORMATIVE
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The applicant/agent was provided with application advice to amend the drawing of this Application to be successful as a Prior Approval Application. .
   ii) The application was acceptable as Amended and submitted and no further assistance was required.
   iii) The application was approved without delay.
